title.narrative: STRATEGIC PLANNING

description.narrative: Strategic planning, coordination and integration are guaranteed and strengthened throughout the CP implementation., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF's 2012-2016 Country Programme for Brazil is effectively implemented, and Brazil's situation is monitored and evaluated in an integrated and efficient manner, with an equity approach and integrating cross-cutting issues that address the various dimensions of inequality in the country.

participating-org.narrative: ASSOC VOLUNTARIOS PARA O SERVICO INTERNACIONAL
FUNDACAO PARA O DESENVOLVIMENTO CIENTIFICO E TECNOLOGICO EM SAUDE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategic planning, coordination and integration are guaranteed and strengthened throughout the CP implementation.

description.narrative: BCO's planning section coordinated several activities regarding the Country Programme developments, national planning meetings that provided inputs for the preparation of key corporate documents such as AWPs, EOY-RAM and COAR 2016. Such activities guaranteed a smooth transition from the previous CP to the new one. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Rate of implementation of UNICEF Brazil Gender Action Plan

actual.value: 2016:Planning sections worked to embed gender-sensitive approaches within all Business areas and to mainstream a gender perspective in the new CP's 2017-2021 components according to the strategic objectives of the Beijing Platform for Action.

title.narrative: Number of events to develop staff' and partners' capacities in results-based programming, including HRBA and gender mainstreaming

actual.value: 2016:Training sessions were not conducted within the reporting period. However, two national planning meetings were conducted in Brasilia with the participation all BCO's sections, Field Office's Managers and frontline staff.

title.narrative: Percentage of active theme groups (meeting at least once a month) for each programmatic area

actual.value: 2016:UNICEF actively participated in 6 out of 6 UNCT and thematic group meetings in the last semester of 2016.

title.narrative: Number of joint UNCT initiatives with participation of UNICEF

actual.value: 2016:UNICEF actively participated in 6 out of 6 UNCT and thematic group meetings in the last semester of 2016.

title.narrative: Percentage of intermediate results on track or completed on RAM

actual.value: 2016:100% of active outputs on track or completed by end-of-year in 2016.

title.narrative: Satisfaction level of key staff trained on results-based management, HRBA and gender mainstreaming
Level of grants implementation within grant expiry date

actual.value: 2016:As per scorecard, 100% of the funds were used within the grant expiry date.

title.narrative: Quality of planning documents and milestone processes implemented by UNICEF

actual.value: 2016:Quality of planning documents has improved. Planning staff reviewed seven donor reports and supported the preparation of four donor proposal. Planning section also contributed to the assessment of 07 small and larger scale proposals for partnerships with CSOs in the second semester of 2016.
